response:
Investigations should confirm the presence and pattern of optic nerve dysfunction, exclude compressive or inflammatory structural lesions, evaluate for demyelinating disease, and screen for vascular, autoimmune, infectious, toxic and nutritional causes that would change management, particularly giant cell arteritis or a treatable systemic disorder.

investigations = ["MRI of brain and orbits with gadolinium contrast", "Formal automated visual field testing (e.g., Humphrey perimetry)", "Dilated fundus examination by ophthalmology", "Optical coherence tomography of optic nerve head and macula", "Visual evoked potentials", "Full blood count", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "C-reactive protein", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "Fasting blood glucose", "HbA1c", "Fasting lipid profile", "Vitamin B12 level", "Folate level", "Serum angiotensin-converting enzyme level", "Antinuclear antibody", "Extractable nuclear antigen panel", "Antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies", "Aquaporin-4 IgG antibodies", "Myelin oligodendrocyte glycoprotein (MOG) antibodies", "HIV serology", "Syphilis serology (treponemal and non-treponemal tests)", "Serum protein electrophoresis and immunofixation", "Lumbar puncture with CSF cell count, protein, glucose and oligoclonal bands", "Temporal artery ultrasound", "Temporal artery biopsy"]
